entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 4:44AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow On The Taylor Highway Above 3000 feet Tonight Through Wednesday Night... Snow is expect over summits of the Taylor Highway tonight through Wednesday night with up to 3 inches of accumulation through Wednesday night. Hunters and motorists venturing above 3000 feet should prepare
entry.cap:areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 4:44AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Significant Snowfall In Eastern Alaska Range Tonight Through Wednesday Night... Snow is falling in the Eastern Alaska Range above 2500 feet, with heavier snow above 3500 feet. The Richardson Highway from Black Rapids south could see 3 to 6 inches of accumulation through Wednesday night. Above 3500 feet, which is higher than the highway

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued September 21 at 8:18AM MST until September 21 at 10:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM MST THIS MORNING FOR MARICOPA COUNTY... At 818 AM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued September 21 at 7:59AM MST until September 21 at 10:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Arizona, including the following county, Maricopa. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 2:49AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...One more cool day with showers and thunderstorms... * Showers and thunderstorms can be expected this morning, with increased chances again this afternoon. Fast storm motions will help to mitigate flash flood risks. Generally, rainfall accumulations will be a few hundredths up to a few tenths of an inch, but localized areas could pick up to 0.5".
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.title: Flood Warning issued September 21 at 10:55AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The National Weather Service in Miami FL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Florida... Fisheating Creek near Palmdale affecting Glades County. .Recent rainfall in the Fisheating Creek basin have led to rising water levels and minor flooding is now forecasted as additional heavy rainfall remains possible.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued September 21 at 10:15AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. For the St. Johns River...including Astor...Minor flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 1100 AM EDT.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 9:52AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heat Index Values of 100 to 105 expected today... One more day of record heat is expected across the quad-state region today. Heat index values in the late morning and afternoon will reach 100 to 105 degrees. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. A significant cooldown will arrive tonight as a cold front moves through the region.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 2:49AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...One more cool day with showers and thunderstorms... * Showers and thunderstorms can be expected this morning, with increased chances again this afternoon. Fast storm motions will help to mitigate flash flood risks. Generally, rainfall accumulations will be a few hundredths up to a few tenths of an inch, but localized areas could pick up to 0.5".

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 2:03PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Gusty winds expected through Wednesday... A slow moving, strong low pressure system off of the Northern California Coast will bring gusty south winds to much of Nevada this afternoon with a frontal passage expected to repeat these winds Wednesday. South winds have already increase this afternoon reaching speeds of 25 to 30 mph and gusts around 30 to 40 mph.
